intro: Ludwigia uruguayensis var. major, commonly known as the Uruguay Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as marshes and stream banks. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in aquatic and bog gardens.
